fields.physical_description:
Design: printed card. The back of the box and the larger cards are printed in blue to show 4 illustrations of the baby's head around an illustration of a cow and gate.  The words COW & GATE are printed around the outer edge
Cow & Gate are makers of baby food
Waddy Productions is marked on a metal tool which is part of B.721-1997 together with the patent pending date 1935.
fields.title: The Cow and Gate Happy Family game; Smiler
fields.historical_context_note:
Rewards: n/a
Forfeits: n/a
No. of Players: any
Equipment required: 48 cards arranged in 12 sets of 4
instructions card
card listing the names of all the families
box, printed in colours to show title, baby `Smiler' and 3 adults.

Rules:
INSTRUCTIONS FOR PLAYING THE COW & GATE GAME OF HAPPY FAMILIES
1.  The game can be played by any number of persons.
2.  The cards are dealt round until exhausted.
3.  Players then take up their cards and sort them (as far as possible) into families of four.  Each completed family should then be placed face downwards on the table in front of the player.  Play then commences by the player on the left of the dealer asking any person he chooses for any card he wants to make up one of the families he has in his hand.  If the player has the card asked for he must give it up, then the first player can ask again, but if he has not the card asked for he should replay Not At Home and then it is his turn to ask for such cards as he requires.  NB A player may not ask for a member of a familiy unless he has one or more of this particular family already his hand.
4.  The game continues until everybody's families are made up, when the player with the greatest number of complete families is often declared the winner.
5.  At this point, the game may be lengthened by the player with the greatest number of complete families asking any player to hand over any family he may believe him to hold.  He continues asking while he is successful, but when he makes a mistake the right to ask passes into the other's hands.  The game is won by the player who finally holds all the cards.  
A COMPLETE PACK CONSISTS OF THE `ALLSMILES' FAMILY (Mr., Mrs., Miss & Smiler); The `Dose' Family; The `Carr' Family; The `Pill' Family; The `Cowangate' Family; The `Churn' Family; The `Cheerful' Family; The ¬Dunkley' Family; The `Giles' Family; The `Feedus' Family; The `Nice' Family; The `Allwise' Family.


GENERAL HAPPY FAMILIES RULES

Three or more can play and special cards are normally used, each showing four members of a family, mother, father, son and daughter,  However, variations have been developed to use groups of 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7 to a set.  Also subject variations occur and some are educational, for example The Counties of England.

The object of the game is for each player to collect as many complete `families' as possible.  
One of the players deals out all the cards.  If more than one round is played, the players take it in turn to deal.  It does not matter if some players have one card more than others.
Each player looks at his cards and sorts them into families.
It is important that players keep their cards hidden from each other.  With young children it is a good idea if they can lay their cards out of view of the other players.
When all the players are ready, the person to the dealer's left asks any player, by name, for a particular card (eg Master Baker).  He must already possess at least one of member of the same family, ie Mrs. Baker.  If the person asked has the card, he must give it to the first player, who may again ask anybody for a card of any family as long as he already has one card belonging to that family.  
He continues to do this until he fails to obtain a card.  If the person asked does not have the card requested, it is his turn to ask for cards.
When a player collects all the cards of the same family, he puts them into a pile face down in front of him.
Play continues until all the families have been completed
The winner is the person who collects the most families.
